headline: A Daring ‘Bluebeard’ Reappears
abstract: Bausch’s pivotal 1977 work “Bluebeard,” with its relentless gender battles and powerful drama, returns to the stage after a long gap.
lead_paragraph: WUPPERTAL, Germany — The dancers lay in darkness on the floor of a studio here. Although a video was playing, they closed their eyes and focused on listening: to the fervent, intense voices of Bartok’s opera “Bluebeard’s Castle,” and to sounds of breathing, screaming, silence, laughter, sobbing and the sibilance of rustling leaves.
keywords: Bluebeard. While Listening to a Tape Recording of Bela Bartok's 'Duke Bluebeard's Castle' (Dance)
